has big plans for Mass.

Mike Napoli, the Red Sox’ big free agent acquisition, is now thinking about how his serious hip condition will affect him long after his playing days are over.

Fingerprint checks snare
many lacking crime records

Federal officials are deporting more immigrants in Massachusetts for civil violations than for serious crimes under a fingerprint-sharing program.
Opinion | Jeff Jacoby

Crime soared with Mass. gun law

In 1998, the state passed what was hailed as the toughest gun-control legislation in the country. It was predicted that the law would prevent future gun violence. It didn’t.

City Hall finally gets voicemail

A new phone system at Boston City Hall will allow the first widespread use of voicemail since Mayor Thomas Menino took office 20 years ago.
